The complimentary breakfast the next morning was very nice - eggs, sausages, cereal, yogurt, danishes, toast, juices, soy milk!, skim milk!, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, bananas - and that is all I can remember although there were other choices too. The total hotel is very clean, fresh and well tended. The front desk staff was super and very helpful with lots of suggestions for whatever we needed. Another little perk they offer is bicycles they LEND out for those who want to take a spin around the university and surrounding areas. Lastly, the hotel has a free van that takes visitors to and picks them up from different venues around Seattle. We wanted to go to Pikes Market for the morning and Ivan the driver was so pleasant and courteous - even dropping us off at a particular spot we wanted to go to. All in all, one of our favorite hotel experiences ever. Because we like to go to Seattle 4-6 times per year, we have decided the Watertown will be our hotel of choice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just what was needed”
Reviews.Author: jmgillette
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to get out of town (Nor Cal) for our 10th anniversary and decided to visit a place we had never ventured, Seattle. Without knowing much about the area we booked our travel based on recommendations from this site. We could not have been happier. When we arrived we were greeted with the surprise of an upgrade to a suite. The room was really spacious. We both loved the ultra-modern urban feel of the room and hotel. The staff was gracious and the shuttle drivers do a great job of accomodating requests that are outside of their normal route. After walking through much of the city the U district was a choice I would make again. If you have not walked the UW do it. The architecture is amazing. We could have spent hundreds more for a downtown hotel and made a huge mistake. Great job Watertown! Thanks for a memorable trip. BTW - make a reservation at Chez Shea if you have the chance, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: aymazing
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Watertown in mid-October 2007. The hotel was easy to find and centrally located (took us about 15 minutes to downtown on surface streets, but plenty to do around the hotel iteself). The front desk staff were cordial and helpful, and the lobby felt refined without being stuffy. Free cookies were available at the front desk, and the small "general store" (just a few shelves, but well-stocked) was perfect. The room was clean and airy, with lots of natural light. The furnishings felt modern, and the beds were very comfortable. The Watertown had lots of little extras, like both synthetic and down pills, comfortable robes, Aveda bath products, a great binder of info about the area (in addition to local magazines and publications), a map of the area folded into the key folder, spacious parking, etc. The hotel is within walking distance of a convenience stores, restaurants, movie theater, and the U of W campus. All in all, absolutely worth the room rate. I was delighted by the whole experience and will gladly stay again. Thank you, Watertown!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, awsome amenities!”
Reviews.Author: viquiv
Reviews.Content: I've never written an online review but this hotel was so great I just had to. For a very reasonable price (I had booked on Priceline, but for some reason the reservation didn't go through -I blame priceline, so called and asked for the internet rate of $149) you get a high end experience. My love of this hotel started Saturday morning when I headed out for a walk around the area. I saw their shuttle sitting out front and asked when it'd be heading downtown. The driver was sitting there and asked "when do you want to go?" He took me right then and scheduled a time to pick me up. The next day when I asked them to book me a cab to take me to the bar down the street they had recommended, they offered to check with the shuttle...and sure enough, it was going to be around in a few minutes, so they took us down the street on their way out to town. They have the basic hotel "general store" items downstairs but also offer some Trader Joes items for purchase since it's just down the street. They've got coffee and tea available 24/7 and fresh baked cookies each afternoon. Delicious! They said they're going to be opening their Wine bar during the weekends, which was the down side. You can rent bikes for free, use the University pool, order one of their "entertaniment carts" and they even have loaner umbrellas for those rainy days in Seattle. The rooms were totally clean and quite stylish, the beds were comfortable and the room even had a huge full length mirror. The only word of caution: the windows aren't tinted, so if you look out onto the street, don't do it naked! I loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OTBART1
Reviews.Content: My family was on vacation to celebrate my parents "62 year wedding anniversary". They met and married in 1945 and came back to Seattle to celebrate. I read the reviews about this hotel on the tripadvisor website and decided this would be a perfect place for my parents to stay in style. Starting with my initial call to make the reservation I was very impressed with the staff on their customer service and knew the hotel was the #1 pick for us. Upon arrival (free parking) we were greeted by friendly smiles and a wonderful staff (baked cookies too). I requested a special room with a view for my parents... I was not disappointed. The room was on the 5th floor with a view of Mount Rainier. The room was huge! We started calling it the apartment while we were there. I love the layout of the room...double closet the best! My mom loved the Starbuck's(24/7). We all enjoyed the winetasting and breakfast was fresh. We used the Spa cart and DVD cart -what a nice perk for free! We didn't use the free shuttle, but it was nice to ride the town car back to the airport for only 35 dollars. The workout room had a variety of new equipment/free weights to use-it was very clean. Speaking of clean... the place was immaculate! I slept on a pullout queen sofa and it felt like a regular bed...no lumps, bars or backaches. I want to THANK each and EVERY STAFF member at this hotel from the front desk, housekeeping, breakfast and wine tasting servers, and everyone else for making my parents 62 wedding celebration one that they will never forget. It was amazing and next time we are back in Seattle, I will not hesitate to book my room with the WATERTOWN HOTEL-#1 HOTEL IN SEATTLE.

Reviews.Title: “writing it in my room”
Reviews.Author: edwardgb
Reviews.Content: I am writing this while I am at the hotel. First time ever did not have my room made up when I got back to my room. Didn't leave my do not disturb sign on all day. They just missed my room. Called 5 minutes ago to tell them told me i had to have left my do not disturn sign on my door. Dont my people making mistake, mind when they tell you its your fault.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JW59
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Seattle. We found the hotel through a search engine online. Our experience was great! Staff and service was excellent. The hotel amenities were unbelieveable - breakfast (eggs, yogurt, bacon, bagels, fruit); free wine tasting during the week; free shuttle service...the list goes on. We felt very comfortable at the hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: theangus1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great hotel (especially a non-chain hotel stay), I strongly suggest the Watertown in Seattle, WA. They have great rooms, a terrific and very accommodating staff (meeting all the needs of travelers w/ young children) and a free breakfast that will start your day off right. A visit to this hotel will make any stay in Seattle wonderful. They also have a lot of other extras (at no charge) that we did not even get a chance to take advantage of (bikes, themed carts, etc.). Other hotels would not even dream of offering these extras. Five star recommendation.... Regards, Zach

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: PaulInOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Watertown from 9/11 through 9/13/07 as part of a tour of Seattle/Vancouver/Victoria. We booked the Watertown based upon reviews here at Tripadvisor. This hotel more than exceeded our expectations, particularly for hotels in its price range. First, the hotel. The rooms were large, clean and very modern in design, with an in-room safe, dorm-sized fridge, microwave, and coffee pot, complete with complementary coffee and popcorn. Views were so-so -- our room looked over an empty lot that was being rebuilt. If you want to see the Seattle skyline, then pay more for a downtown hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is a few blocks away from University Avenue, which is the main drag for the University of Washington -- lots of shops, restaurants, etc. Just around the corner from the hotel is a vegan restaurant, Araya, if you're looking for vegan/vegetarian cuisine. The hotel also has a free shuttle service to/from downtown, so you can park your car in the free and secure, gated parking lot at the hotel and let the drivers take you downtown and pick you up. You can get downtown on the hour and picked up on the half hour, and if you're not sure how long you'll be, you can call the front desk to arrange a pick-up time and one of two pre-arranged pick-up spots. When we were there, the downtown buses were free to ride, which made this service even more valuable. The hotel is also along several bus lines if you prefer that route. There is a major shopping mall just down down the street, including a 24-hour grocery store (QFC), though you'll need your car to get to it. If you live in the midwest, the QFC is part of the Kroger chain, so if you plan to buy some groceries for the room and want to take advantage of the loyalty discounts, bring your Kroger card, which they'll accept! The complementary breakfast is outstanding -- scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon (different each day we were there), lots of oatmeal, cereal, fresh fruit, muffins, bagels, toast, juice, coffee, tea, dairy and soy milk, etc. All you need to get started (or pack a light lunch...). The workout room is relatively small but functional -- couple of bikes, some free weights, a couple of treadmills -- and is also where the free washer and dryer unit is located. You need to supply your own detergent or buy it from the front desk. We didn't have any problems using the wash, but since there is only one of each, it could conceivably get busy, so plan accordingly. Although the gym closes at 10 p.m., you can access the washer/dryer throughout the night with your room key. Oh, and the hotel also features themed complementary "carts" that you may want to check out if you have some time in the room. We tried the spa cart, which included a portable massager, foot bath, some salts, tea, and other bath products. Very nice way to end a day of walking! Other carts included a computer/printer combo, kids carts, board games, etc. (Book the cart in advance or when you check-in). If you need internet access, the room comes with complementary wired internet and even includes the CAT-5 cable so you don't need to bring one. Our room TV lacked any A/V inputs so we couldn't watch any DVDs or Netflix downloads from our laptop, but since we didn't get into the room until late both nights, that didn't really matter to us. They do have a movie cart, though, if you want to borrow a TV/DVD hook-up and watch movies. As others have noted, the hotel also has a wine bar, but we didn't have a chance to try it ourselves. Prices for wine and food seemed reasonable, though. Overall, this hotel was a great value and we would definitely recommend it if you're looking for an affordable, unique alternative to traditional and expensive downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff”
Reviews.Author: Vince77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 2 nights in July. We had planned a great honeymoon trip over the Pacific northwest region and it started really well thanks to a great staff. As soon as we said we were on honeymoon we got a bottle of wine with a bag full of nice treats with a congratulation note. How nice is that? Very clean, the rooms (our room was on the 2nd floor, no view but we could see the mount rainier) could be a little more personalized but in the style it's perfect. Good fresh fruits in the breakfast buffet and nice wine tasting everyday. I would recommend it highly although it is more convenient than romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Europeantraveler74
Reviews.Content: The Watertown is an extremely pleasant place to stay in Seattle. I have been in many hotels, for private and professional reasons, and confirm without any reservation that this hotel is definitely worth the money, and I cannot imagine that in Seattle you could find a better deal! Together with my family I spent a total of three nights in this hotel (going to and returning from a trip to Canada) and both times we had a very nicely decorated, modern, spacious and very clean room. When my son asked for internet access, the hotel staff sent a PC to our room, fully equipped, and cost free. Great! Also, on two occasions the hotel arranged transportation for us, to the airport and to the port, at a very decent price. To note that hotel staff was always extremely helpful and polite. A minor point: Breakfast is offerered at a place which is a bit small for the number of people showing up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at the Watertown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chloegone
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one-week stay at the Watertown Hotel. My husband was there teaching at the University of Washington and I was a tag along. The hotel is very clean, the staff is very helpful and the breakfast every morning was just right. I used the shuttle service every day. Jim, the driver, was so nice and put up with the questions I asked every day about things to do in Seattle. The rooms are very comfortable and included a small refrigerator, microwave, room safe, and ample drawer space for all your stuff. Must use your room key to get above the lobby entrance. It is a five-block walk to the University. Did not use the bicycles, because there are lots of hills (much to my surprise). Free wine-tasting every evening. There is a great mall downhill from the University area with shopping, restaurants, and two grocery stores. So, very safe, clean rooms, excellent service, free parking in an underground garage, free breakfast, free shuttle service to various locations, great weather while we were there, great experience. Going back next year, will go back to the Watertown. Good place for business visitor, families, and groups. There were at least two women's volleyball teams staying there. Things I can recommend doing in Seattle: Sightseeing tour of the city to get your bearings. Go to the Space Needle, but for the best view of the city, pay $3, go to the top of the Columbia Center at 5th and Columbia. Pike Place Market-could go every day for food, people watching and street musicians. Walk about the waterfront. Take a short cruise around the harbor. Drive about 30 minutes away from Seattle and see Snoqualmie Falls. Took a 25-minute seaplane city tour with Kenmore Air from Lake Union area. UNBELIEVABLE. Did not have time to go to Victoria, but plan to take a seaplane and do this next year. Good restaurants on Lake Union. That's All!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Margo
Reviews.Content: A Boutique Hotel. The rooms could be bigger but were extremely functional. Great bathroom lighting and a microwave and fridge in every room. Ask for a room on the side that views Mt. Ranier on a clear day. They have bikes to loan (I think for free). The breakfast buffet was limited, but included in the room rate . Parking and security were good. They have free "carts" to loan out with themes (board games, books, aromatherapy, etc.). The shuttle to town is small. The staff was accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious hotel in University district”
Reviews.Author: benders
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Watertown Hotel and found it to be a comfortable up to the minute place. Our room was very spacious with a king bed, sofa and chair and work station and welcome extras such as a free washer and clothes dryer (provide your own powder). Breakfast was included in the tariff. It was a modest affair, but adequate. The hotel is situated about three small blocks walk from the University and "The Avenue" (where there are plenty of cheap eateries) and there is ample public transport to take you down town. There is also a hotel shuttle bus. We enjoyed our stay and would be very happy to recommend the Watertown.

Reviews.Title: “Like a clean serviced apartment, feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: hcychan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in August just for pleasure. My partner and I drove down to Seattle from Vancouver BC. Easy to find, great location, easy access to the university and close to neat neighbourhoods like Wallingford and Ballard, etc. The building looks like an apartment building, very new and urban-looking, as if you're right in the city. Checkin was quick and easy, almost a little too casual for a hotel. The checkin counter looks like one in a dentist's office -- very casual. Loved the free parking in a very safe underground garage -- you can only access with your hotel key. Feels just like living in your own apartment! Stayed on the top floor (6th) corner room overlooking downtown. We requested a top floor room, and we got it! We loved it! The room was super clean, and almost felt a little too dull. Perhaps the rooms need some colorful art work or flowers to liven up the place. My partner said he almost felt as if he was in an old folks home! that's how clean, quiet and simple everything was! curtains roll up, TV swivels 360 so you can watch from the bathroom area. Great Aveda products. Loved the "Staff Picks" in their room info binder -- good recommendations for dining, etc. The Ala Carte options are a super idea! We chose the Spa cart and it came with foot massage, hand held massage, a CD player with relaxing music, and spa hair and body products. loved it! such a great treat. they have all sorts of Cartes, from video games to art supplies! Complimentary breakfast was good -- fruits were fresh, eggs and sausages were decent. They have complimentary bike and video rentals, and a small exercise room. About a 10 minute walk to the University campus. A few cafes in the area, but not too much to do. University village (great shopping, restaurants) is about a 5-10 min drive from the hotel. I'd recommend this place and would definitely return. Downtown Seattle is just not worth the overpriced boutique hotels and parking when you can stay here -- only a 20 mins drive away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gmitchellc
Reviews.Content: For the money-this hotel is a great value. The location is very convenient to explore the wonderful surrounding areas of Seattle. The rooms are large and well laid out-many with views of Mt Rainier. Staff is helpful. Free Breakfeast-well you get what you pay for. A final tip, Seattle proper is less than overwhelming-much of it is seedy-use your time to explore all the great areas aound-San Juan Islands, Mt Ranier, Olympic Forest, etc. and use for dining only. GC

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: azhottraveler
Reviews.Content: The Watertown is an oasis in a dirty university area of Seattle. It is sophisticated and comfortable. We were on the top (6th) floor and had a great view of the Seattle skyline. However, don't look down. The surrounding area leaves a little to be desired. We did find practical stores within walking distance and it turned out to be better than our 1st impression but not the Seattle experience that others have described. The room is designed to be efficient and fit all necessary conveniences into a small space. The staff is exceptional. The breakfast is passable.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: SimonHilditch
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, has lots of things included like evening wine tasting that you would not expect. A litte way out of the city centre but they definately made up for it! The hotel was very clean, stylish and modern. Staff were very friendly and not too over the top with it. The only mistake we made was not double checking the time we booked for the shuttle bus, they arrived an hourly early and missed us. D'oh!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Watertown”
Reviews.Author: khoffDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Watertown July 28-Aug 1 based on reviews here. We were very happy. The room was quite roomy and lacked only decent reading light, but we have found that a common problem in hotels. The hotel does offer free parking, but travellers without cars should know that in addition to the hotel shuttle, there is terrific city bus service -- we rode buses to and from various parts of downtown, to Capitol Hill and to Ballard, all from within a few blocks of the hotel. The hotel staff printed out relevant bus schedules for me -- it would be even nicer if they had a rack of printed schedules available. Within a few blocks' walk from the hotel, in addition to the many shops and restaurants on University Ave., we found a 24-hour donut shop, Trader Joe's and a great discount book store called Half-Price Books (all on Roosevelt Ave uphill from the Watertown, on 45th, 47th and 48th.)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Watertown”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye16
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Watertown for a week for our first visit to Seattle. Chose it based on tripadvisor reviews. All downtown hotels were $325 and up per night during this particular week. We got a very fair AAA rate ot $159 at Watertown and had a wonderful experience. Staff was welcoming, kind and courteous. Service was fantastic. Complimentary breakfast was excellent offering a large variety, including hot items. Free secure underground parking right under the hotel saved us at least $30 per day. Although Watertown doesn't have a pool, guests can use the pool at their sister hotel a block down the street, which we did. We took advantage of one of their unique free entertainment carts. We used the movie cart. They have a large cart selection that include game carts, book carts and others. The rooms were very nice and very clean. They were immediately attentive to anything we needed. Although not downtown, it is not too far removed. Easy access to I-5 makes getting downtown a breeze. A very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great either”
Reviews.Author: travellingteachers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our little get away to Seattle. While there, we spent two nights at the Watertown. The location is a little out of the way when it comes to the attractions in the downtown core but thankfully the hotel provides a shuttle into the city. I wouldn't call this an upscale hotel by any means. Don't get me wrong; it's a nice, clean hotel but nothing out of the ordinary. Comfy bedding and the room is a decent size. While waiting for the shuttle we took in the complimentary wine tasting which was a nice touch. Also the breakfast is one of the better complimentary breakfasts I've had - bacon, eggs, english muffins, bagels etc... I'm a light sleeper and the garbage truck woke me up each morning just before 6am. Not fun! Plus, the door handle of our bathroom kept falling off! We were locked into the bathroom at least once a day. We asked the front desk to take care of it, but while they made sure it didn't fall off anymore, the lock itself was broken and then locked my husband in. All in all, I would probably stay there again. While a little out of the way, it's a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lentz
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at The Watertown and were pleasantly surprised with our experience. We had a studio suite with a great view of Mount Ranier. The room was spacious, clean and filled with amenities. We were very happy with the room. They do offer complimentary breakfast every morning that includes, beverages, eggs, bacon, bagels, muffins, yogurt, fruit and cereal. There is free underground parking which is a value in itself in Seattle. There are free bikes and a complimentary wine tasting every night that we did not have a chance to enjoy either. This hotel is a value compared to staying downtown Seattle and actually is a very convenient location.They have a small little store by the front desk if you need a beverage or snack, they also provide coffee and coffe maker and popcorn with a microwave in the rooms.We were thrilled with our stay here and will stay here next time we come to Seattle. An incredible find!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel in the University District of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Seattle four or five times a year. As a couple that enjoys boutique hotels, my wife and I found the Watertown Hotel to be satisfactory, but certainly nothing to get excited about. We usually stay at one of the Kimpton Hotels (there are three in Seattle), but all three Kimpton Hotels were sold out for the July 6 to 8, 2007 weekend due to the Kenny Chesney Flip Flop Summer Tour 2007, so we looked over Seattle hotel reviews on Tripadvisor. The Watertown Hotel was the only top 5 rated hotel in Seattle with a room available (they told me on the telephone it was their last available room), so we booked the room for $185 (plus tax) per night. The Watertown Hotel is located in the University district, about six miles north of downtown Seattle. It is a safe area with plenty of restaurants located within walking distance of the hotel. Our room, like the property itself, was clean and well looked after. The room had a comfortable King bed, basic washroom, tiny fridge and a small television set. Our room was located off the elevator lobby on the fifth floor, so there was a lot of hall noise until well past midnight both nights of our stay. There is free, secured parking, located under the hotel for hotel guests, but the parking stalls are tiny and the ceiling only six feet, six inches high, so larger vehicles may have problems parking. Also, the breakfast selection was not satisfactory (limited items, with no fruit or healthy eating options), so we wandered over to the Farmer's Market (five blocks away) for breakfast one morning and we drove to the 14 Carrot Cafe for beakfast the second day (located a couple miles from the Watertown Hotel at 2305 Eastlake Ave E on the way to downtown Seattle). In summary, we would stay at the Watertown Hotel again, but it will never be our first choice in the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: GigiHouston
Reviews.Content: Watertown Hotel is the place to stay in Seattle if you like excellent, friendly service from the entire staff, very nice rooms, and convenient location. We had a marvelous stay there last weekend. The hotel offers many amenities as you will see when you look at their website. It even offers complimentary shuttle service to the downtown area and free use of bicycles.There is a wonderful bike/walking trail (Burke-Gilliam Trail) about four blocks from the hotel. If we ever have the chance to return to Seattle, we will definitely stay at the Watertown again!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: cactusdave
Reviews.Content: We found the Watertown after a terrible experience at the University Inn. We paid the book rate of $185/night and it was worth it. The room was modern, luxurious, and the bathroom had a great spa feel. Great amenities with Starbucks coffee in the lobby, beautiful complimentary bathroom, and exercise room where you can use their bikes to ride around. The university campus is a stone's throw away as is the delicious Portage Bay cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Turtle
Reviews.Content: Located near the university, this hotel has all of the amenities and services that any business traveler would need. There is free wireless in rooms and a complimentary breakfast bar with healthy options and eggs and bacon served after 7 AM. The fitness room is well maintained with multiple treadmills, weight lifting machines, and some free weights, and there are bicyles available for exploring. In the evening there was free wine tasting in the lounge. I tried the complimentary spa "ala carte", which came with Tazo tea, soothing music, bath products, and a hand massager. The furniture in the rooms is contemporary and very comfortable. There's a refrigerator and microwave oven with popcorn and extra coffee and tea. The staff were friendly and very helpful. This is definitely one of the best hotels that I've ever stayed at for business and quite a bargain, given the rate on the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Pete B
Reviews.Content: We loved it! Large Retro rooms w/ nice view from the upper floors. Plus FREE bike's to use! We spent all morning biking down to the water-front and along the Seattle bike-path. Its a 15-20 min. bike ride to the water-front w/ a few busy intersections; but once you get down to the water-front its really a great way to see the city. Coming back is slightly up-hill. And the restraurant just down the block from the hotel (The Portage) is Fantastic. In fact, the Portage does a FREE wine sampler in the hotel eatting area a few nights a week. They also serve tasty appetiziers which we made a meal out of.... FYI: Once you are down-town, on bikes, it's a 1 or 2 block walk uphill to see the Pikes People Market. Lock the bikes up where everybody else does.... Great Breakfast here too! Plus they offer a FREE "cart" service. ie" We wanted more books to read, at the end of our trip, so they sent up the "Book Cart" which had like 20 books and we swapped out a few. They have a video cart, a computer cart, a kids cart---etc....15 different carts.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: noodlesPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Clean, nicely decorated, freshly made cookies at check in, free internet/computer access and printing!, free shuttle to the action, great breakfast- yogurt, eggs, sausage, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, juices, starbucks coffee, tazo tea, and muffins. staff was very nice and helpful. definately check out Mama Melina's. its about 5 blocks up the street on Roosevelt. amazing italian with piano player and opera singer. chicken marsala was EXCELLENT! price was $15. very very worth it! wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Stay at the Watertown”
Reviews.Author: Christi0903
Reviews.Content: What a delightful time our stay in Seattle was, largely due to the friendly and accomodating staff at the Watertown Hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It is comfortable, conveniently located, and provides complimentary shuttle service. And perhaps best of all, they have bikes on loan, and will gladly guide you on the best scenic routes to traverse.

Reviews.Title: “a great experience”
Reviews.Author: phdnjmom
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel through tripadvisor and stayed in it as an alternative to the high-priced city-center hotel we were considering. we enjoyed the experience tremendously. the staff was pleasant and easy to deal with--in fact the hotel generally had a relaxed and laid-back air about it. we enjoyed the room and the decor. we also really liked the "ala cart" options and enjoyed the one we chose. the university area is a nice area to stay in--close to shopping, close to city-center, close to the university campus--a great alternative to the city itself. we had a great run and loved being so close to the university-area trails. we didn't get a chance to take the free-rental bikes out on one of the trails, but hope to next time.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, good access to UW, a bit far from the action”
Reviews.Author: karenrobbins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov 2006, and had a good experience overall. The rooms are clean and modern, with nice bathrooms. Didn't notice much noise, but stayed mid-week for 2 nights. Good access to the university and hospitals, but a bit far from downtown and touristy sights and sounds. They do provide a complimentary shuttle to downtown and other locations in the area, which helps. The staff was very helpful and couteous. Nightly wine hour at the restaurant, which also serves food. Also, the AM continental breakfast was very good. Overall, would stay here again if coming to visit the university, but would probably opt for something in another area of the city if I wanted to see the sights/sounds of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, helpful, and reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: kf824
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Watertown for 3 nights in April, 2007. I had a room on the 6th floor and the view was very nice when not too overcast, obviously not the fault of the hotel. My room was a suite and had 2 queens, a USB cord for internet access, a double-sided wardrobe, microwave, refrigerator, full-length mirror, laptop friendly safe, well lighted bathroom mirror, cute porthole bathroom door, and full sized bath and shower. The room also comes with a bag of popcorn (mine seemed to be a bit old though) and tea. The full-length shades blocked out light and made it easy to sleep in or to gain a lot of light during the day. The heater/AC was in great condition. Each room is equipped with a "cart". I unfortunately had one that had a Seattle Here and Now book, two coffee mugs, and coffee. Other ones that they provide (if you want a specific one you should ask in advance before checking in) include music, games, movies, library, kids, art, spa, sleep, grumpy, party, and surf cart (printer and internet). A copy of USA today is delivered each day as well. They provide cookies daily at the front desk. hey also have a mini-convenience store for last minute snacks. It was very safe as the elevators require a key card to access guest rooms. The complimentary breakfast was better than most free breakfasts; it included a variety of tazo teas, Starbucks coffee, juices, yogurt, fruit, bacon, eggs, cereal, English muffins, and bagels. The Forty-Two provides wine tasting and meals but were a little pricey for my liking. If you prefer something a little more affordable, there is a 24-hour IHop about 2 minutes walking distance off of 41st street. The complimentary shuttle was easy to access as long as you planned in advance but was a much nicer ride than the city bus. However, the shuttle is only available between the hours of 7AM and 7:30PM but went to a variety of locales. The gym room had 1 treadmill, 2 elipticals, a stationary bike, and freeweights. In addition, bikes were available to take for a day provided good weather. Overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: danibryt
Reviews.Content: What a treasure! For most people staying downtown Seattle would be preferred, but for my money I will stay in the UW district of town. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were huge. I definitely recommend a corner room when you stay at this hotel. We took advantage of the great guest carts available for us to check out that suited the needs of my family. We also chose to leave our car in the free underground garage and take advantage of the city's excellent bus system. Walking around the University distict was great too and it gave us a really feeling for the area. The free breakfast was perfect for us, and we ate too many of their delicious afternoon cookies.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewJanes
Reviews.Content: Wow, this was one of the best hotel experiences I can remember, and it's very good value for what you get. The rooms are so spacious and beautifully designed, unique very modern and elegant furnishings and design, so comfortable. The staff are super helpful, but one of the best features is EVERYTHING is included, no extra charges for internet and the wide variety of interesting little extras they offer, snacks, games, movies etc. Every time we return to Seattle we are now staying here, even though for some visits focussed on downtown there would be more convenient hotels. I'm really looking forward to the next excuse to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, one little miss, one bigger miss”
Reviews.Author: AlohaMember
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Watertown over the week-end, checking in late Friday and leaving first thing Monday morning. The hotel is very easy to find, and they offer free cover, underground parking which is very nice. Checking in was a quick painless process. They offer a very good free breakfast, and is very liberal with providing free newspapers (Seattle Post, New York Times on the week-end, USA Today on weekdays). The room is big with a separate work desk and an extra sink in the main part of the room. There is a sign on the bathroom sink that says the tap water is filtered (never seen that anywhere else). The little miss was a welcome card, candy, bottle of mineral water, coupon for 2 free items at the hotel's convenience store BUT addressed to someone else. When I returned the card and coupon etc., the front desk person the next day said "sorry" and that was it. : ) The bigger miss was that I could hear the person on the top (6th floor) directly above me, trodding around the room. This was at 6 in the morning, and woke me up from desparately needed sleep. I was wishing bad things upon him / her. By then, I was up and couldn't get back to sleep. Thankfully was only 1 night. In spite of the above, I would still recommend the Watertown, since a lead footed person is not really the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: dulce19
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel on a visit to the University of Washington. We were continually impressed. Everything about our stay was wonderful: from the view to the continental breakfast. Complementary underground parking was FREE and made having a rental car less of a hassle. The various carts were a neat idea, and my partner really enjoyed the spa cart while relaxing with a cup of tea in our room. The room had all the amenities we could want: coffee maker (with Starbucks coffee), refrigerator, cable tv, in-room safe, Aveda bath products...they even had bathrobes!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: jetaapres
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Seattle many times, in the Lake Union Area, downtown and near the WA Convention Centre. This was my 1st experience in in UW area. I have to tell you that I have never had a better experiece and thoughtful, caring service than at the Watertown. This is a modern, clean hotel that has really remembered that customer serive is what it is about. If you have business with UW and especially the UW Medical Center, this is the place. I strongly reccomend it! Ronn Patton CSU East Bay

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations in Seattle University District”
Reviews.Author: cacaoqueen
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here three times, and would need to have serious ongoing need to be downtown to consider staying anywhere else. Family members live nearby in the UD, so this is a convenient location. The whole place has a crisp, modern aesthetic, with great textiles. Rooms are clean, green, spacious and comfortable. Great beds and pillows. I really don't need to bring my own. I appreciate the recycle container in the room, web access, fridge, safe, microwave and good coffee. And exercise room , parking and laundry facilities. You can borrow a bike if you'd like to. And it's totally nonsmoking. Breakfast is served downstairs in an area that doubles as a winebar/tapas place in the evening. It's a fine contental breakfast, all I need and more. There is also a shuttle to UW, downtown, etc, but we haven't used it. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel...but a few bugs to work out”
Reviews.Author: HandsomeRube
Reviews.Content: my wife and i recently stayed 7 nights at the watertown and were pleasantly surprised at the quality of not only our room (we stayed on the top floor on the south side of the building...highly recommended), but also the hotel as a whole. the facility was very clean and modern without being too stuffy and lifeless. big pros... -the complimentary bikes and free shuttle service...while we didn't take advantage of the shuttle, we did use the bikes on the nearby burke-gilman trail. -better than average continental breakfast...not stellar, but certainly good. -secure underground parking -location...close to most major attractions. and the views of downtown from the top floor on the south side of the building are fantastic. noticeable cons... -only one computer for the entire building for internet service...and, it's located in an awkward place right alongside the front desk staff. no privacy whatsoever... -one washer and dryer for the entire building...plus it's a pay machine. this is inexcuseable...you can stay at any larkspur landing for less money and get more machines for free. they really need to consider an upgrade to more machines for the building and make it complimentary. -when we asked for a late checkout, we were told the room we were in was needed immediately (on a sunday afternoon!)...it complicated our checkout process greatly not having that extra hour. despite the above complaints, i would stay at the watertown again...the room was really wonderful and the staff were very accommodating for the most part. have a room with 2 or more computers for complimentary internet (like the larkspur landing)...and add more laundry machines...and you have yourself a top-notch hotel at a relatively affordable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - TERRIBLE accoustics”
Reviews.Author: 3411pdx
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this place two different weeks. I love it - I love the concept. However, BRING EARPLUGS! This is the second time that near midnight the footsteps of the guests above sound like kick drums. I'm not a light sleeper. There's nothing to be done about this - but it is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good wheelchair access”
Reviews.Author: Melissa M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for four nights in May 2006. I'm a wheelchair user and chose the hotel based on price (cheaper than downtown Seattle), complimentary continental breakfast, proximity to shopping and eating spots around UW and wheelchair accessibility. We booked directly from Australia via email and fax and were very pleasantly surprised to receive a prompt, written confirmation of our booking. The hotel and staff did not disappoint in the slightest. The staff were young, friendly and helpful, the room accessibility good (no roll-in shower though - something that seems common in accessible hotel rooms in North America). Accessible bus transport to the downtown area is close by and a taxi fare was only approximately USD$12. The location for us was great. As first-time visitors to Seattle, we did not 'click' with the city as a whole, but really enjoyed the eating spots and shopping in the area around the hotel. Several cheap cafes and restaurants were located just three blocks away. The hotel itself did not offer room service, but had a fantastic in-room dining arrangement with a wide variety of restaurants offering delivery to your room. On our last day, we were booked to travel by train to Chicago, but were having difficulty getting a taxi to take us and our luggage downtown to the train station, despite the best efforts of front desk staff. The staff kindly offered to take us at no cost downtown using the hotel shuttle, even though this was strictly speaking not accessible (I needed assistance to get into the shuttle). Overall, a great experience and a hotel highly recommended for any Seattle stay.

Reviews.Title: “5-star staff, 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanSeattle
Reviews.Content: My family and I were surprised and delighted with our stay at the Watertown Hotel. We were delighted with the nice, nice, approachable staff that were imbued with a sense of service and pride. Surprised by the lovely design and the cleanliness of the hotel. Nice colors, finishes and great furniture choices make the hotel feel inviting and upscale. Delighted by touches such as Starbucks as the in-room coffee choice. And, the free Internet accessâ€”setting up the laptop was a breeze. We were very comfortable and appreciated the unobtrusive security and convenience the hotel offers. The Portage Bay Cafe right down the street was another plus. All in all, a great place to stay in Seattle if you like a sophisticated comfortable hotel with an urban twist.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelming service”
Reviews.Author: thanks2all
Reviews.Content: All members of staff were accommodating, pleasant and helpful. The shuttle service was excellent; the designated pick-up and drop-off points were conveniently located, and the drivers were always available. The manager actually went out of his way to deliver several items that I had forgotten in the safe before I left the city. I highly recommend this hotel, and will certainly stay there during my next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Have to Agree--Watertown is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer333
Reviews.Content: After trying all different Seattle downtown and north/south metro hotels over the years, I gave Watertown a shot based on all the great reviews and--wow--was everybody right! I was there 4 nights and it poured pretty much everyday but was a restful and relaxing place to stay. I had a suite which reminded more of some of the modern boutique hotels I've stayed in large cities in Australia and Europe. I loved that the windows opened (European style) and the spaciousness of the suite, and all the funky yet very nice decorations. Breakfast bar each morning was better than most any I've ever had--who has guava juice besides here? The free parking was also a draw for me and saved me a good $80 over the downtown hotels that charge an arm & a leg. I had a trade show at the Seattle convention center and it was a snap getting there & back--less than 10 minutes even with Seattle's notoriously horrible traffice on I-5. When it wasn't raining I did get out to walk to the shops & restaurants in the University District, which were just a few minutes away. This hotel is very convenient off of I-5 and in the U District, but was very quiet and located in a nice non-busy neighborhood. I'll never stay anywhere else in Seattle from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Pouring Rain - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoCal_BizTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Watertown for a meeting at UW. Not sure where to start. The flight was terrible, weather wet, and meeting mediocre. The hotel was perfect. First, I drove into the secure underground parking lot - dry and out of the wind. Perfect. Next, upon checking in I was given a flight of wine at the hotel's lovely lounge. They also had a nice bowl of fresh, hot, organic and local soup with bread. Finished with warmed cookies. And a pick of a very nice local wine for a great price. Perfect. The room was simple with some nice touches. First they gave me the book lovers cart (free) with lots of fun books to read. When I come back with my baby, we'll get the art cart or kids cart (or both!). Coffee, tea and popcorn (unlike chains, they don't charge you $10 to touch the stuff, it's included). Filtered water, nice bathroom and a sink with drawers. Perfect. The rooms were business traveler AND kid friendly. Very bright and airy. Windows opened in a kid-safe manner, room was spacious, and my view was of the UW campus and bay. Lastly, they accommodated me by letting me keep my car in the garage rather than making me go find parking on campus after I checked out. They also gave me a nifty map with my room key. Staff were friendly locals who made sure everything I needed was available to me. I've been staying at Hyatts, W, Omni hotels for a month on travel and this one seemed to be the perfect blend of just what I needed without the fuss (and added expenses) of other hotels. I will absolutely return this summer with my family and next year for my annual meeting at UW.

Reviews.Title: “Hi tech zen and total comfort . . .”
Reviews.Author: Sharonae
Reviews.Content: Four nights at the Watertown and we didn't want to leave! We've stayed in everything from large glam hotels to charming B&Bs, but no place made us want to stay much much longer as the Watertown did. . . let me tell you why: Large, airy rooms. Very comfortable beds. Fast and free internet connection via one USB. Microwave/refrigerator/coffee maker beautifully tucked away in a large galley-like unit. Free shuttle every hour. In the hotel restaurant '42' a lovely breakfast included: coffee, teas, eggs, bacon, yogurt, cereals, bagels, juices, toast, fresh fruit. Evening wine tasting, fabulous soups - $8+/-, and small plates $10+/-, hearty breads. Free gated parking under hotel. Fast elevators. Spotless rooms and public areas. The MOST friendly and helpful staff in the history of tourism. I'm attaching some photos so you can have an idea of the style of the Watertown. It is simply elegant with an Asian sensibility in every detail.

Reviews.Title: “Our new fave hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: AEC in SF
Reviews.Content: We always rent a car, so the location's fabulous for us -- you're so close to I-5 and 45th Street that getting anywhere in town is simple and fast, and free parking in a secure garage can't be beat. If you're doing the usual tourist stuff, they'll drop you off downtown in their shuttle. The design is modern but not too wild; the beds are comfy, and the views gorgeous. The bathroom layout is great for two people: the toilet and shower are in a private room, and there's a large vanity in the dressing area, separated from the sleeping area by a freestanding closet that opens from both sides. Free breakfast is so-so, but you get what you pay for. The people who work here were very helpful and polite; housekeeping stayed out of our hair when we wanted to sleep in, and yet managed to clean the room every day. We paid $145 a night for a room that would have cost close to twice that amount downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The Watertown: Great rooms, great views!”
Reviews.Author: Oswego73
Reviews.Content: We live nearby, and when we had to (on very short notice) move out of our house for a week during some remodelling work, we found the Watertown online, and booked a week there. I'd known friends who'd stayed there because it was near the University, but we'd never been there and had just driven by on occasion. Our experience was top-notch: we showed up about an hour after we'd made the reservation online (and about 2 hours after our contractor told us that we'd need to vacate our home for 5 days!), and they were very organized, and prepared, given that we'd just made the reservation. Our room was beautiful, and the view of Lake Union and Queen Anne was lovely. We enjoyed the proximity to the U-District, and ended up walking everywhere or taking the bus downtown... it was easiest just to leave the car in the parking garage and hop on a bus to get downtown, or just walk a couple of blocks to dinner, shopping, and grocery stores. Plus we could walk to all the movie theaters. So, we ended up having an unexpected but great stay in the Watertown, and had a fabulous time exploring the area on foot, which we hadn't done for ages. The fixtures, linens, and finishes were all luxurious and elegant, and our room felt very spacious. The staff made our stay even better: they were professional, welcoming, and helped us with bus schedules and movie times. The breakfast was also decent: we didn't expect The Four Seasons, but it was miles above a typical "continental breakfast" in a hotel chain. Real coffee, fresh juice, and organic yogurt w/ fresh fruit. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Watertown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: touristfromTexas
Reviews.Content: Nice clean urban hotel in the University District, near University Village Shopping Center. Comfortable bed, Hairdryer, coffee maker, Starbucks coffee, filtered water, mini fridge, microwave, iron and ironing board, bathrobes, free underground secure parking. Complimentary continental breakfast; wine tasting in the evening and fruit and cookies in the lobby. We had two bathrobes the first night, and for some reason the second and third nights, only one. I didnâ€™t complain because it wasnâ€™t a big deal to me. Also, they were out of decaf coffee â€“ but we went out and bought our own. Free shuttle to downtown and to the Needle area. We took the shuttle to downtown â€“ very convenient. We reserved a time for leaving the hotel and called later to arrange for pick-up. This was great since we didnâ€™t have to worry about parking in downtown Seattle. They have high speed internet but we didnâ€™t have our own computer so we were able to use a computer in the lobby to print out our boarding passes the day before our flight home. We ate at Blue C Sushi at the University Village Shopping Center. It was a fun restaurant with the revolving sushi conveyor belt â€“ I had the cooked food. Also went to the Essential Bakery CafÃ© in Wallingford on 34th Street, which has great sandwiches and desserts.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AWaysToGo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night when we took our son to UW. We booked through Expedia for a standard room, but was upgraded to a Jacuzzi Spa room. It was fabulous. Starbucks coffee & machine, teas, microwave with popcorn, nice tv and a sofa in room. Underground parking safe and very clean. Apples, cookies and wine tasting when we arrived. Asked for the spa cart and it was lacking... a few sample shampoos, a massager, and a broken aroma thing. Staff was helpful in booking restaurant. Breakfast was packed so we went to a great cafe down the street... Portage Bay Cafe. Great french toast and omelets!!! Probably will stay again next time we visit son.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timely
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Watertown in late August for a wedding. Rooms were spacious and well laid out. In room service was exceptional. The car service to downtown Seattle was well managed and we used it several times. The morning breakfast was super. The staff were very helpful. We cannot say enough about this fine Hotel which is worth its title of A Unique Urban Hotel. Thank you - the Clock family

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Misled”
Reviews.Author: agia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site for Labor Day Weekend. Thought the reviews were to good to be true based on other guides that listed this hotel. As I quickly learned on arriving, this is just a basic budget hotel. The hotel was clean and the staff was accomodating but they appeared to be young inexperienced college students. From the studio descriptions listed I expected a kitchenette with a full sized refrigerator and a stovetop. Instead it was your usual small hotel refrigerator and a small microwave. Don't think you are going to get a studio like other hotel chains that offer a studio. The continental breafast was pathetic. The main item being offered were boiled eggs (for breakfast no less). The only thing I had at breakfast was a glass of guava juice. I thought the price was rathar high at $155 a night but I reasoned that if I was receiving a studio at a splendid hotel it would be a bargain. Instead I received the basic hotel room with no room service ,no view to speak of and an uncomfortable bed. To me it was worth about $90. You must know that the area this hotel is in is not the best. I tried to find a good restaurant on Universty Ave. in the area and felt unsafe with some of the individuals that approached me on the street for money. I checked out after the first night. Ended up staying at a Homewood Suites near downtown (see review) at about the same price and was completely satisfied. In conclusion I would say that unless you need to be near UW or Safeco Headquarters you probably can find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Apala
Reviews.Content: Our family thoroughly enjoyed our 2-night stay at the Watertown. On first sight, it actually looked more like a new condominium. The room was spacious, modern, clean and well kept. We even had a great view of Mount Rainier, the Space Needle, and parts of downtown Seattle. The staff were very courteous, helpful, and obviously took a lot of pride in their hotel. The breakfast was very good and satisfying. The "surf" cart (computer and printer) was a real bonus as it allowed me to help plan the rest of our vacation in the Pacific Northwest. The free downtown shuttle was very convenient and a real cost saver, reducing the number of days of renting a car. When we did get a car, the secured underground parking came at no extra charge, unlike most hotels in the downtown area. It is conveniently located in the University area with its wide variety of restaurants, markets, stores, and bus routes. Just about our only disappointment was not having enough time to take advantage of the hotel's free bicycles and explore the nearby trails and not being able to get reservations here during the third portion of our trip. The Watertown is a truly unique hotel and I wish that there were more hotels like it throughout the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ESLer
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent alternative to the hotels in the crowded downtown area. The Watertown is in the university district of Seattle. The rooms are large, with great views, spotless and extremely quiet. The staff were uniformly helpful. The breakfast (included in the rate) was superb, and there is a daily wine tasting, free to hotel guests. Bicycles are free so you can bike in the area or to nearby parks (Green Lake is good). Within walking distance are many small restaurants serving different ethnic foods and several good bookstores. The hotel also provides a free shuttle to and from downtown. I can say nothing negative about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Mitch&Ove
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting Seattle and you don't mind being an easy 20 min bus ride away from downtown then book this hotel!! Stayed in the Watertown Hotel after reading good reviews on Tripadvsor. So glad we did! The room was lovely - big, beautifully furnished and equipped (massive bed, airconditioned, great bathroom, microwave- complete with popcorn, starbucks coffee provided etc etc) and the hotel was clean and smart. We turned up for the complimentary breakfast, thinking it would be a curled up danish and lukewarm coffee to find that there was a choice of juices, cereals, bagels, danishes, eggs, bacon, sausages, yoghurts, and loads more). The hotel provided free, secure parking, a laundry, free loan of bikes, a gym and best of all, complimentary carts. Order them when you book or arrive and a cart will be delivered to your room. We borrowed the relaxation cart (lovely spa products - body lotion, bath salts etc, a food spa, massage machine, CD player and relaxing cd's) and the internet cart (computer and printer), but there were loads more on offer - a games cart (lots of board games), kids cart (plug socket covers, kids bath toys etc), grumpy cart (not sure what was on this) night night cart (aromatherapy products and white noise machine) to name a few. Although the hotel is a bus ride out of Seattle's centre, it was still a great location, in the middle of the University district. There were lots of good bars & restaurants just a block away. The hotel provides a free shuttle service downtown and it's also on main bus routes. We reckoned this was one of the best hotels we'd ever stayed in when you considered the location, room, standard of breakfast, service etc. Didn't want to leave & would definately stay there if we ever visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: NCjohnboy
Reviews.Content: What an enjoyable stay. This hip, stylish hotel was a bargain at $155 per night. Excellent service at the front desk. The room was large and the beds were very comfortable. Everything seemed new. They showed an attention to detail that is very unusual. A water filter under the sink. Alcohol swabs at each telephone. Real scrambled eggs and great bacon at the breakfast buffet that was included in the price. You get the idea. Very nice neighborhood with easy access to I-5.

Reviews.Title: “U-District Find!”
Reviews.Author: farlucy
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend at the Watertown. We really enjoyed the unique amenities such as complementary bicycles, evening wine-tasting, free shuttle, and chocolate chip cookes. Guests can also request themed 'carts'. We chose the spa cart, which included a foot messager and message wand. The hotel is clean and rooms are generous in size. They gave us a complementary upgrade to a suite, which was great. Large room with living/dining area. Only minor complaints: wireless internet was pretty slow (although we never tried using their cable connection), and once the shuttle left without us despite our having made reservations. Suggest if you plan to use the shuttle be downstairs and on watch for its arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views at Watertown!”
Reviews.Author: austinbride05
Reviews.Content: We loved the Watertown! Not only were they very accomodating, but the view in room 606 was awesome! I highly reccomend booking this room if possible. There is a beautiful view of downtown Seattle (yes, you can see the Space Needle) and Mount Rainier. The breakfast was great and they offer Starbucks coffee to boot. I arranged for the bicycle picnic pacakage, and it was really great. The bikes were in great shape, and they provided not only dinner, but a backpack with all utensils and plastic cups and a blanket. We requested a vegetarian dinner and were not dissappointed. Watertown provided Aveda products, and the mini fridge was very helpful in keeping our wine cool. Front desk staff were very helpful with directions, and held something I had forgotten until a week later when I was able to pick it up. Definitely a choice hotel for a night in the UW district. Free internet in rooms too!

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like the Watertown, but......”
Reviews.Author: Gretchen44
Reviews.Content: Our first two days at the Watertown were great. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the chocolate chip cookies in the lobby. It was a good value for the price we were paying....until our 3rd day. We left at 7am in the morning and when we returned at 3pm I was surprised to see a maid's cart on the floor. I didn't think much of it until we went in our room and saw that the room wasn't made up. We were in town for a wedding that was starting in 2 hours, so we picked up a couple towels from the floor and started getting ready. While I was in the shower housekeeping stopped by. My husband explained that we were getting ready and to come back after 4pm. A few minutes later we got a call from the front desk saying that if we didn't get our room cleaned right then that it wouldn't be cleaned at all. Finally the front desk said that the room would be made up after 6pm. That was fine with us, since we were going to be out until late in the evening. To our surprise at 4pm housekeeping showed up again. We were almost ready, so told them to come back in 10 minutes and we would be gone. Two minutes later the front desk called and said that the maid had left and that our room would not be cleaned up. The conversation went back and forth with the front desk. Even at a Motel 6 I expect to have my room made up. In the end as we were leaving I gave the front desk my blackberry number and told them to have the manager call me if they were unable to get our room cleaned. The clerk at the front desk (who was giving us some serious attitude) got off the phone (with whom appeared to be the offsite manager) and announced that she was going to clean our room and to not exepct much since she wasn't a trained housekeeper. We returned to a room that appeared to be cleaned, except for that there were no bath towels in the room and instead we were left with 5 bath mats! Maybe that was the clerk's way of getting even with us. The front desk appeared to be staffed by college students and not once between Thursday and Sunday did we see a manager or someone who appeared over 25 years old. I really question who is in charge here. I shouldn't have to argue with a clerk over whether my room is going to be cleaned, especially when I was gone for 8 hours during the day. I did contact the manager when I returned home. They did say that my experience should not have happened. They offered me $20 off a future stay. No thank you. I'd rather stay some place where I can be assured of clean towels and no attitude! If everything is going well and you have low expectations, I think the Watertown is a fine place to stay. But if anything out of the ordinary happens (like housecleaning not being able to get rooms clean by 3pm), good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Successful girlfriend's shopping weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Watertown Hotel. Every stay has been absolutely wonderful. I am so glad I found this Hotel on Tripadvisor. This past weekend, two girlsfriendds and I stayed at the Watertown Hotel. My girlfriends who have stayed at the Fairmont previously, said they preferred the Watertown Hotel espcially for a girlfriends shopping weekend. Getting to the highway was easy and convenient. The room rates are reasonable, the parking is free and breakfast is included. Which gave us a great start to our power shopping day! The room size was perfect and the tall mirror is great for checking out our shopping purchases and the vanity on the outside of the bathroom was great! After a long day of shopping, we watched a movie on the Xbox - all provided by the hotel. One of my favorite perks is access to Starbucks coffee all day/night. All three of us had an absolutely wonderful time at the hotel. Thanks again Watertown! My girlfriends said they would definitely return to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: aboxall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Watertown during a visit to the University of Washington. The staff were brilliant and the accommodation and facilities were excellent. Clearly a lot of thought has gone into making guest stays as comfortable as possible. Even though the hotel is a little out of town, the public transport system is so good and cheap that this doesn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location + Lots of Perks”
Reviews.Author: Cousin_Jeff
Reviews.Content: My daughter is interested in attending the University of Washington, so she and I visited Seattle in April and stayed at the Watertown. It's only a few blocks from the UW campus - easy walking distance. The hotel had many amenities that appealed to us and made it our choice over the cheaper hotels available in the campus area: - Bikes and helmets are available free of charge. We took a nice ride along the nearby Burke-Gilman Trail. However, their bikes were not in the best condition. They told me some were "in the shop", and those that were left were barely adequate. If you're a serious biker, I'd call ahead and make sure there are some good ones available. - Free "carts" of various entertainments were available. It turned out we didn't use any, but I can see how they'd be great for families with young kids in particular. - Free high-speed Internet. - Free shuttle to the downtown (and back). - Free breakfast, which isn't at Embassy Suites quality, but does include scrambled eggs, cereal, and scones. And there are chocolate chip cookies in the lobby. Rooms are nicely sized and attractive. Also lots of cable channels available. The Starbucks coffee and candies were a nice touch too. There is also a reasonably priced shuttle (Town Car!) service to and from the airport, so we didn't have to rent a car or pay for parking. Info is on their web site. Overall, I'd say it's a very good value for the Seattle area, and I'd recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, quiet respite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visit Seattle because we have family there. Often, our daughter and son in law's home has other quests so we stay in a hotel. In five years we have tried several. Never have we had a more reasonably priced, clean, comfortable stay than at the Watertown. The Watertown will be our only hotel choice in the future. We felt safe, got the rest we needed and were delighted with our stay. They provide these wonderful carts with books, toys, movies, whatever the need to fill your down time with an entertaining, and meaningful things for guests to do. The staff is friendly and helpful. Well worth your consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Dana5002
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Watertown hotel for 3 nights, March 8 thru the 11th. Since we were there to visit the University, it was within walking distance. What a wonderful hotel and a fantastic staff!! Everyone was so helpful in helping find places to go, restuarants to try, and points of interest in the city. We ended up having an extra teenager with us and they were very accomandating in finding a bigger room. No one seemed like it was a bother to help, they were eager to make us happy. A great breakfast was served and of course Starbucks coffee was in every room! I was very impressed with everything in the hotel. I would go there again next time we are in the city. I reccomend this place to anyone who comes to Seattle. Thanks Watertown Management and STaff for making us feel so welcome!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for UW Graduation!”
Reviews.Author: love2gonow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Watertown because we attended the UW Graduation. Fabulous! Spacious, clean, great ammenities, internet access, very nice breakfast (included), free secured parking, shuttle to campus, fresh cookies and even umbrellas! Loved it and highly recommend to anyone going for UW Graduation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We chose it because it is located close to the University of Washington and we were visiting our son. However it has many other benefits that will make us stay there again. For example, they have free parking, a very nice and convenient buffet breakfast, carts with videos, computers, or other interests which are available without charge, and a washer/dryer on your floor which can be used without charge. They also have wine tasting in the evening. We borrowed their bicycles to get some exercise and visit the Gasworks park. It was a great experience. The staff is very helpful and friendly. It also is a very secure hotel in which you have to use your charge card type key in the elevators to go up to your floor. The only negative thing I can contribute is that they need to maintain their bicycles better. Otherwise I would recommend that Watertown Hotel to anyone visiting Seattle, especially if you wabt to stay near UW.

Reviews.Title: “A great single woman's retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small treasure, and should be complimented for the wonderful hospitality I enjoyed while there. My husband had surgery at UW Med Center and not only was their location ideal (with complimentary shuttle service to the hospital), but the staff went out of their way to make me feel at home. The hotel's secure underground parking and the overall atmosphere in the hotel made me feel safe. I also felt welcome and totally comfortable sitting alone in their wine bar in the early evenings, where I could wind down with their complimentary wine tasting, and also where I enjoyed a couple of light dinners. Their complimentary a la carte movies were wonderful in- room entertainment. I'd recommend this clean and smartly decorated little hotel to anyone planning to be in the U district, not downtown Seattle. Its convenient walking distance to banking, eateries and shopping was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best North Seattle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Downpat
Reviews.Content: What a cool hotel. Definitely the place to stay in north Seattle. Love the shuttles to downtown, the U village shopping center and Adobe. Now my favorite place to stay when I am not required to be in the downtown area. Love all the extra touches like the alacarts. The free wine tasting, cookies and breakast were awesome.The lite meal was perfect on one of the coldest nights in Seattle in a long time. We did not want to out for dinner too cold. The warm hospitality made the difference. I also liked the added security touches of the keyed elevator. Will definitely stay there again! Great Value!

Reviews.Title: “Not in the City”
Reviews.Author: chiph1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average with some interesting amenities. Most importantly, it is 5 miles from the city center, therefore the location relative to most of the other top 20 hotels is sub par. Seems the reviews on this site fail to really get that across. I was fooled by the hype and positive comments and not having travelled to Seattle, I was unaware of how far this hotel was from the others in the City. Definately not a top ten hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SalukisGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our way through Seattle last year. This is now one of his favorite hotels. I had lived in Seattle, so I knew the location, while away from downtown, was still near some great neighborhoods. Rooms were very clean and modern, staff was helpful, Starbucks and Tea all day in the lobby. We used the free loaner bikes, which were a great way to get around. This was a great place to stay in Seattle, w/ lots of perks, at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and dad, sister, husband and I stayed here over Thanksgiving. There were several parts of our visit that made it memorable. 1) comfortable beds with nice sheets 2) accomodating, helpful staff 3) free wine tastings and delicious cookies 4) loaner bikes and bike maps 5) great location in the U-District 6) snack bar features healthy food too 7) building is in great shape at only 3 years of age, yet is very inviting 8) a la carte program makes the hotel unique We will definitely stay here the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Unique Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Easy to see why this little gem is listed as one of Seattle's top five. I've stayed in Hilton's in Melbourne Australia, Thistle Hotels in London and none compared to the simple pleasures and friendliness experienced at the Watertown! Be sure to take advantage of their Ala carte service. First time I've ever had a business center come to me. And if you've come to sleep - these are the absolute best beds I've encountered in a hotel - bar none.

Reviews.Title: “Our Only Place To Stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stopped counting the number of trips we have had to make to Seattle this last year. This is our very favorite place to stay because of the outstanding facilities and excellent location. We appreciate the healthful breakfast buffet and having a variety of morning newspapers readily available. We had fun on the bikes this summer when we rode through the university close by. During our latest stay, we requested and received a wheelchair accessible room which met our needs. We find the staff very accommodating and friendly. Having the city map with our room key is just one of the thoughtful things that is part of this hotel's way of saying they care about their guests. Of course the variety of carts that are available is a first for any hotel we have ever stayed. There are too many good things about this hotel to mention.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Free Bikes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with lots of nice touches. We stayed in June and had a fabulous time making full use of the free bicycles to travel around Seattle - the pool and the gym are very good too. I loved the little touches, like the free trolley, delivered to the room, with the foot spa, back massager and chill-out music. The wine tasting was another lovely touch. In fact, there are so many free 'extras' that it is hard to fit them all in. The rooms are very modern, without being stark and the location is great. The free taxi to the downtown area was also a boon and the staff were incredibly friendly with great service all round. The hotel was very reasonably priced and I would recommend it most highly. The hotel manages to anticipate what its guests might enjoy and succeeds in ensuring that they feel welcome and pampered. We came back to the UK fitter and more relaxed - which can't be bad. I only wish hotels in the UK could meet these kind of standards.

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Watertown”
Reviews.Author: sleepycow
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience. The staff couldn't be more helpful, the only problem is that they are going to burn themselves out if they keep going at this rate. We stayed first of all in the Boardroom Suite then in the View Suite - with great views. Well worth just walking up to 'The Ave' just a few blocks away, to visit the 'quirky' shops in the University district.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Watertown. Quiet, comfortable and great staff. I would return again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler, to the northwest and other parts of the country, and of the countless hotels, B&Bs and Inns that I have stayed in I have never experienced customer service as I have at the Watertown in the University district in Seattle Washington. As I said I am a seasoned traveler, and have become somewhat picky with my accomadations but the staff at the front desk took care of my every whim almost instantly. One girl gave me reviews area resteraunts that sounded like she was more of a food critic than a front desk agent. I was amazed by everyone that I encountered on my stay and will surely be returning the next time that I am in town!!

Reviews.Title: “A delicious destination”
Reviews.Author: Norimaki
Reviews.Content: I love the Watertown. I stay there every time I'm in Seattle. Myself and my girlfriend spent our third weekend there last month and were as impressed as always by the generous and delicious buffet breakfast, the loaner bikes they have for guests, the clean, bright, airy feel of the lobby and rooms. This was for our first time getting one of the more expensive rooms, and gasp, what a great room! A corner room, with jacuzzi tub, spacious, hip colour scheme. We were both loathe to leave the room. And those spa/ games/ music carts... what a nice touch. Worth the cab ride from town every time.
